messages.content:
Session Checkpoint: CODITECT One-Click Installer

  Completed

  Created GitHub repo and submodule:
  - Repo: https://github.com/halcasteel/coditect
  - Submodule: coditect-rollout-master/submodules/coditect

  Installer System (install.sh):
  - One-click: curl -fsSL 
  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/coditect/main/install.sh |
  bash
  - Installs coditect-project-dot-claude to /opt/coditect (read-only)
  - Creates ~/.coditect symlink
  - Sets up Claude Code integration (~/.claude/)
  - Adds bin/scripts to PATH
  - Configures hourly update checks via launchd

  Update System (update.sh):
  - Silent hourly background checks
  - macOS notification only when update available (not auto-install)
  - User runs coditect-update to install
  - Flags: --check, --force, --quiet

  Uninstaller (uninstall.sh):
  - One-click: curl -fsSL 
  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/halcasteel/coditect/main/uninstall.sh |
  bash
  - Removes installation, symlinks, auto-updater, PATH entries

  User Commands:
  - Terminal: coditect-update, coditect-check, coditect-version
  - Claude Code: /coditect-update, /coditect-check, /coditect-version

  Branding:
  ┌───────────────────────────────────────────┐
  │  CODITECT [Installer/Uninstaller/Updater] │
  │  AI-Powered Development Framework         │
  │                                           │
  │  © 2025 AZ1.AI INC. All Rights Reserved   │
  │  LICENSED | 2025-11-19-v6.1 | 1@az1.ai    │
  └───────────────────────────────────────────┘

  Cleaned up:
  - Removed .coditect from ~/.claude (now handled by installer)

  ---
  Next Steps:
  1. Verify halcasteel/coditect-project-dot-claude is public on GitHub
  2. Test full install/uninstall cycle
  3. Add LICENSE file
  4. Consider Linux support (cron instead of launchd)

  - Dedup state updates
  - Archived exports

> if we set it public can people pull without registering and paying with a 
credit card? I need to track my users and I do not want people to see the 
code?
messages.content_preview:
Done. Committed and pushed to coditect-rollout-master:
  - CODITECT installer submodule reference
  - Dedup state updates
  - Archived exports

> if we set it public can people pull without registerin...

messages.content:
No - a public GitHub repo means:
  - Anyone can see all code
  - No registration required
  - No user tracking
  - No payment gate

  Your requirements need a different approach:

  Options for Tracking Users + Hiding Code

  1. Private Repo + Registration Portal

  - Keep repo private
  - User registers on your website → gets personal access token
  - Installer uses their token to clone
  - You track all registrations

  2. Hosted Binary/Package Distribution

  - Don't distribute source code
  - Package scripts into installable binary
  - Host on your server with download tracking
  - User downloads from az1.ai/install (you log everything)

  3. License Key System

  - Repo can be public OR private
  - Scripts require license key to run
  - Key validated against your server
  - Free tier = email registration
  - Paid tier = credit card

  4. Installer with Phone-Home

  - Installer requires email before proceeding
  - Sends usage telemetry to your server
  - You track installs, updates, active users

  ---
  Recommended for your case:

  Option 3 or 4 - Keep code in private repo, installer hosted on az1.ai:

  # User visits az1.ai/coditect
  # Enters email → gets install command with unique token
  curl -fsSL https://az1.ai/install/abc123 | bash

  Your server:
  - Tracks who installed
  - Can revoke access
  - Upgrade path to paid

  Want me to modify the installer to support license key validation or
  registration?

> hybrid 3 & 4. with no free tier 14 day try me, money back guarantee, 
register with email and credit card.
messages.content_preview:
No - a public GitHub repo means:
  - Anyone can see all code
  - No registration required
  - No user tracking
  - No payment gate

  Your requirements need a different approach:

  Options for Tracki...

Got it - SaaS model with trial. Here's the architecture:

  Distribution Flow

  1. User visits az1.ai/coditect
  2. Enters email + credit card (Stripe)
  3. Gets license key + install command
  4. 14-day trial starts (card charged after)
  5. Money-back guarantee if cancelled in 14 days

  Installer Changes Needed

  Let me update the installer to require license key validation:

messages.content:
Updated install.sh with 84 additions        40    log_warn() { echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"; }
        41    log_error() { echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"; }
        42    
        43 +  get_license_key() {
        44 +      # Check if license key provided as argument or 
           + environment variable
        45 +      if [ -n "$CODITECT_LICENSE" ]; then
        46 +          LICENSE_KEY="$CODITECT_LICENSE"
        47 +          return
        48 +      fi
        49 +  
        50 +      # Check for existing license file
        51 +      if [ -f "$LICENSE_FILE" ]; then
        52 +          LICENSE_KEY=$(cat "$LICENSE_FILE")
        53 +          log_info "Using saved license key"
        54 +          return
        55 +      fi
        56 +  
        57 +      # Prompt for license key
        58 +      echo ""
        59 +      echo -e "${YELLOW}License key required${NC}"
        60 +      echo "Get your license at: https://az1.ai/coditect"
        61 +      echo "14-day trial with money-back guarantee"
        62 +      echo ""
        63 +      read -p "Enter license key: " LICENSE_KEY
        64 +  
        65 +      if [ -z "$LICENSE_KEY" ]; then
        66 +          log_error "License key is required"
        67 +          exit 1
        68 +      fi
        69 +  }
        70 +  
        71 +  validate_license() {
        72 +      log_info "Validating license..."
        73 +  
        74 +      # Call license validation API
        75 +      RESPONSE=$(curl -s -w "\n%{http_code}" \
        76 +          -X POST "${CODITECT_API}/license/validate" \
        77 +          -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        78 +          -d "{\"license_key\": \"${LICENSE_KEY}\", 
           + \"action\": \"install\", \"machine_id\": \"$(hostname)\"}" \
        79 +          2>/dev/null)
        80 +  
        81 +      HTTP_CODE=$(echo "$RESPONSE" | tail -n1)
        82 +      BODY=$(echo "$RESPONSE" | sed '$d')
        83 +  
        84 +      if [ "$HTTP_CODE" = "200" ]; then
        85 +          # Save license key for future use
        86 +          echo "$LICENSE_KEY" > "$LICENSE_FILE"
        87 +          chmod 600 "$LICENSE_FILE"
        88 +  
        89 +          # Extract license info
        90 +          LICENSE_STATUS=$(echo "$BODY" | grep -o 
           + '"status":"[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
        91 +          DAYS_LEFT=$(echo "$BODY" | grep -o 
           + '"days_remaining":[0-9]*' | cut -d':' -f2)
        92 +  
        93 +          if [ "$LICENSE_STATUS" = "trial" ]; then
        94 +              log_info "License valid - Trial: ${DAYS_LEFT} 
           + days remaining"
        95 +          else
        96 +              log_info "License valid - Active subscription"
        97 +          fi
        98 +      elif [ "$HTTP_CODE" = "402" ]; then
        99 +          log_error "License expired. Please renew at 
           + https://az1.ai/account"
       100 +          exit 1
       101 +      elif [ "$HTTP_CODE" = "401" ]; then
       102 +          log_error "Invalid license key"
       103 +          exit 1
       104 +      else
       105 +          log_warn "Could not validate license (offline 
           + mode)"
       106 +          # Allow installation in offline mode if license 
           + file exists
       107 +          if [ ! -f "$LICENSE_FILE" ]; then
       108 +              log_error "License validation failed. Check 
           + your internet connection."
       109 +              exit 1
       110 +          fi
       111 +      fi
       112 +  }
       113 +  
       114 +  phone_home() {
       115 +      # Send telemetry (non-blocking)
       116 +      curl -s -X POST "${CODITECT_API}/telemetry" \
       117 +          -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
       118 +          -d "{\"license_key\": \"${LICENSE_KEY}\", 
           + \"event\": \"$1\", \"version\": \"2025-11-19-v6.1\", \"os\":
           +  \"$(uname -s)\", \"machine_id\": \"$(hostname)\"}" \
       119 +          >/dev/null 2>&1 &
       120 +  }
       121 +  
       122    check_dependencies() {
       123        log_info "Checking dependencies..."
       124    
     ...
       48            exit 1
       49        fi
       50    
       51 +      if ! command -v curl &> /dev/null; then
       52 +          log_error "curl is required but not installed."
       53 +          exit 1
       54 +      fi
       55 +  
       56        log_info "Dependencies OK"
       57    }
       58

messages.content:
Done. License system implemented.

  What's Now Required

  User Flow:
  1. Visit https://az1.ai/coditect
  2. Register with email + credit card (Stripe)
  3. Get license key
  4. Run installer with license key

  Installer prompts:
  License key required
  Get your license at: https://az1.ai/coditect
  14-day trial with money-back guarantee

  Enter license key: ████████████████

  API Endpoints Needed (backend):

  | Endpoint                  | Purpose
     |
  |---------------------------|---------------------------------------------
  ---|
  | POST /v1/license/validate | Validate license, return
  status/days_remaining |
  | POST /v1/telemetry        | Track install/update events
     |

  License States:
  - 200 + status: trial → Valid trial, shows days remaining
  - 200 + status: active → Paid subscription
  - 401 → Invalid license key
  - 402 → License expired

  Files Created:
  - ~/.coditect-license → Stores license key (permissions 600)

  ---
  Next: You need to build the backend API and registration portal (Stripe 
  integration).
